measured_by: Positive and Negative Affect Schedule, Short Form (PANAS-SF)
justification: The study used the PANAS-SF to assess participants' negative affect, which included specific negative adjectives such as 'distressed,' 'irritable,' and 'nervous.' The scale was administered three times to measure trait, pre-exposure, and post-exposure negative affect.

The unpublished Fear of Weather Scale (FOWS) was utilized to evaluate participants' fear of various weather events such as 'dark clouds,' 'heavy rain,' and 'thunderstorms.' This scale was administered twice to assess both trait and state fear of weather.

The unpublished Weather Risk-taking Scale (WRTS) was employed to measure participants' intentions to engage in protective actions during severe weather conditions. It comprised 14 items related to behaviors in response to severe weather events.
